unnormalised: According to Census 2011, the pop. density of Delhi is 11,320 people per sq km. The male to female ratio, as per the same source, is 868 females per 1000 males. Recent estimates, projecting to 2023, suggest India's total pop. has exceeded 1.4 billion. Detailed demographic data, incl. age distribution and literacy rates, will be available following the 2021 census report, expected Q4 2024. These figures are crucial for urban planning & resource allocation.
normalised: According to Census two thousand eleven, the population density of Delhi is eleven thousand three hundred and twenty people per square kilometer. The male to female ratio, as per the same source, is eight hundred and sixty eight females per one thousand males. Recent estimates, projecting to two thousand twenty three, suggest India's total population has exceeded one point four billion. Detailed demographic data, including age distribution and literacy rates, will be available following the two thousand twenty one census report, expected Q four two thousand twenty four. These figures are crucial for urban planning and resource allocation.
